basics.name: Santiago Espinosa Mooser
basics.summary: Hi there. My name is Santiago. I'm final year Computer Science student at the University of Hong Kong. I'm a DevSecOps and SecOps enthusiast that specializes in increasing security in the software development lifecyle and company operations. My background includes four different internships in DevOps, Pentesting, DevSecOps and SecOps. I am a respectful and proactive member of teams and like to share ideas and work together with other people. I'm currently looking for jobs in the cybersecurity industry, specifically in a DevSecOps or SecOps position.

work.name: Hex Trust
work.description: Hex Trust is a digital asset custody firm.
work.summary: Worked to improve company's cybersecurity posture through the use of DevSecOps and SecOps principles.
highlights: Worked with CISO, Head of Platform and Head of Cybersecurity to propose and implement first-ever DevSecOps pipeline in the company by gathering information about industry-standard tools and proposing said pipeline to developers before implementing it on production.
Automated the implementation of smartcard encryption and the provisioning of Ubuntu-based company laptops through the use of bash scripting. Provisioninig time fell from 2-3 hours to 10-15 minutes.
Responded to security incidents through the use of the company's SIEM and WAF systems and reported & advised on recommended response to the Head of Cybersecurity.

work.name: Handshake Networking
work.description: Handshake Networking is cybersecurity consultancy company that specializes in Payment Card Industry (PCI) security auditing.
work.summary: Worked in various roles due to the small size of the company: Pentesting, Automation Engineering, Web Development, System Administration.
highlights: Independently designed, developed and deployed python-based Django backend API. The API was use to automatically scan vessels aroun the world with the use of remote scanners that communicated through RabbitMQ queues and asynchronous celery tasks.
Developed and deployed full (but simple) DevSecOps pipeline and unit tests on self-hosted GitLab for the API project to speed up the development process.
Installed, managed and maintained XCP-ng hypervisor server and VMs to enable the deployment and use of internally-used services (Bookstack, Samba, Elasticsearch).
Compiled credential list from online sources for use in pentesting
Assisted in the ASV exam recertification by scripting and automating reconnaissance and reporting stages.
Deployed various docker-based services for internal use such as Bookstack (and internal wiki), GitLab and an Ubuntu-based Samba server.
Automated tape backups from XCP-ng server using Bash scripting and transfers.
Developed internal automation tools & web applications for internal use such as an ike-scan & nmap multithreaded wrapper (see github)

work.name: PricewaterhouseCoopers New Ventures
work.description: PWC New Ventures builds software solutions for PWC's client base.
highlights: Worked with the head of DevOps to automate server deployments and provisionings using Ansible and Terraform. This reduced deployment and privisioning time from 3-5 business days to 30-45 minutes.
Wrote and maintained Ansible-based playbook to deploy internal communication tools instance (Mattermost). This deployment used docker-compose and Bash.
Troubleshooted certificate issues on docker-based deployments through the use of tools such as docker-compose, lazydocker and certbot.

courses: COMP3250 - Design And Analysis of Algorithms
highlights: Marketing Secretary (2021-2022, 2022-2023) for the Computer Science Association
Lead organizer for the HKU Computer Science Society's Virtual Career Week 2022.
Director of Internal Communications (2019-2020) of HKUâ€™s feminist group HeForSheForUs

projects.name: Haskell-based interpreter
projects.description: Developed a Haskell-based interpreter for a custom programming language as the final project for the Principles of Programming Languages Course.

projects.name: Computer Science Association Virtual Career Week 2022
projects.description: Organized and spearheaded the 2022 virtual career week event for the Computer Science Association. Involved six speakers from various companies topics, including: Site Reliability Engineer, IT Governance Risk and Compliance, and Software Engineering. Also served as host for three different fireside talks.

projects.name: Unraid Self-hosted Media Server
projects.description: Deployment and Maintenance of Home Media server as well as backup of personal data

projects.name: Complete off-site and offline backup of all personal devices
projects.description: Set up a warm backup system for all personal devices to two separate cloud providers through the use of CGNAT VPN, syncthing and ZFS.
